business.headline: Why the world's ultra-rich are looking for a Monaco addressMore and more of the world's richest people are looking to move to Monaco or at least have an address there. But why is this tiny country, smaller than many cities, drawing so much interest from the ultra-rich?

Soon, every Indian address may get a unique Digital IDThe Centre wants to bring addresses under India's Digital Public Infrastructure (DPI) matrix. Right now, there is no proper system or rule to manage address details in the country.

Belrise Industries share price: Stock lists below expectations with 11% premiumBelrise Industries listing: The company's shares listed at Rs 100 on the BSE, which is an 11.11% rise over the issue price of Rs 90. On the NSE, the stock started trading at Rs 98.50, which is a gain of 9.44%.

Centre proposes bill for online property registration. What it means for you?The Centre has floated a draft bill to digitise property registration. If passed, it could change how you buy, sell, or prove ownership of real estate.
ITC share price falls over 3% today. Here's why and should you buy?ITC shares fell over 3% in early trade. The stock is down 2.02% in the last month, and has fallen over 11% in the past 6 months.

Belrise Industries listing: Will the stock make strong market debut? Check GMPBelrise Industries IPO received a good response from all types of investors. By the end of the three-day bidding period on May 23, it was subscribed 43.14 times.

Income tax return filing deadline extended from July 31 to September 15This extension mostly helps salaried employees and other individuals whose accounts don't need to be audited. These taxpayers generally have a July 31 deadline each year.

Retired before March 2025? Don't miss UPS benefits for you or your spouseIntroduced by the Central Government on April 1, 2025, the UPS provides additional benefits to those who have completed at least 10 years of qualifying service in the Central Government and their legally wedded spouses.

Pakistan's bailout addiction: Why the IMF keeps saving a sinking economyWhy does Pakistan keep turning to the IMF for rescue, but never seems to recover? What's trapping its economy in this endless bailout loop? Dive in to find out.

'GDP means little if it hides empty plates': Analyst on India's inequality crisisIndia's economy may be booming, but over half its people still can't afford three meals a day, notes an analyst. In contrast, smaller African economies like Nigeria, Kenya, and Ghana rank higher in tackling hunger.

Borana Weaves lists at 13% premium: Should you hold or book profit?Borana Weaves' listing was slightly below what many in the market had expected. The grey market premium (GMP) had been showing a possible listing gain of 20-22%, with the premium standing at Rs 43-45 before the listing.

'Could take 50 years': Gurugram startup founder on India matching Japan's lifeIndia's economic journey faces significant hurdles as inequality, agricultural dependency, and regional disparities hinder progress towards matching Japan's quality of life.

Volvo to slash 3,000 white-collar jobs in restructuring move: ReportA major portion of the cost-cutting will come from trimming white-collar roles, which account for around 40% of the company's total staff. Globally, the company has about 29,000 employees in Europe, 10,000 in Asia, and 3,000 in the Americas.

Borana Weaves share price: Stock extends gains after listing at 13% premiumWhile the listing price was above the issue price, it was slightly lower than what many expected. In the grey market, the stock had shown a premium of Rs 43-45 ahead of the listing, which suggested possible gains of around 20-22% on debut.

Good news for exporters as key tax refund scheme to return. Details hereThe Remission of Duties and Taxes on Exported Products (RoDTEP) scheme, which reimburses levies not covered by any other government programme, had been on hold since February 5 but will now resume.

IndiGo co-founder sells $1.36 billion of airline's shares: ReportThe shares were sold at 5,230.5 rupees ($61.35) each, the term sheet seen by Reuters showed, representing a discount of 3.5% to the company's closing price on Monday.

Explained: Why Sagility India Ltd shares fell 5% todaySagility India Ltd said it remains confident of steady performance through the next financial year. It expects growth supported by a strong balance sheet, a wide client base, and consistent business execution.

Broader market indices also faced selling pressure, with heightened volatility dragging down sentiment across the board.

India to become 4th largest economy by end of 2025: NITI Aayog memberIn April, the IMF had said that India is expected to be the fourth-largest economy in the world with a GDP of USD 4.19 trillion in 2025, ahead of Japan.

Rent vs buy? Why young Indians are rethinking homeownershipNot long ago, a house was more than just a home—it was a badge of honour in Indian families. Parents encouraged early buying, regardless of the financial strain. Today, however, younger Indians are rethinking this dream, looking for new paths to stability.

The billionaire blueprint: Inside DLF's ultra-luxury playbookWelcome to the new epicentre of ultra-luxury in India, where DLF isn't just selling apartments, it is curating a billionaire lifestyle and cashing in on the growing trend of 'living life king-size'.

Sensex ends 455 points higher, Nifty settles above 25,000; Eternal tanks 5%At the closing bell, the BSE Sensex was up 455.37 points to 82,176.45, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 148 points higher at 25,001.15. The broader markets also performed well during the session, extending the rally in mid-cap and small-cap stocks.

Is LTA exempt under the New Tax Regime? What you should knowLeave Travel Allowance (LTA) is a common perk in many salary packages, yet with two tax regimes in place, people often ask if the exemption holds true in the new tax regime. Let's find out in this article.

Supreme Court puts Bhushan Power liquidation on hold as JSW seeks reviewThis interim order effectively pauses the liquidation process of BSPL, offering JSW a window to pursue legal recourse and protect its investment interests.

Filing ITR for 2025? Here's why you must verify your AIS and Form 26AS firstOne of the most important things you should do before filing your return is to check your Annual Information Statement (AIS) and Form 26AS. These documents contain details of your income and financial transactions during the year. If you forget to report something, you could end up receiving a notice from the tax department.

Radico Khaitan launches TRIKĀL and Morpheus whiskiesWith the new launches, the company's goal is to dominate both the luxury and super-premium categories, building on the global success of its flagship Rampur Indian Single Malt.

ITR utilities not live yet: Will the e-filing deadline be extended?Many taxpayers are wondering if the delay in these filing tools means the return filing deadline will be pushed. But that's unlikely. The deadline for those who don't need to get their accounts audited remains July 31, 2025.

entertainment.headline: Ravi, estranged wife Aarti remove posts on marital dispute amid divorce battleActor Ravi Mohan and his estranged partner Aarti removed their statements about their marital dispute from their social media pages. This came after the court ordered them to refrain from sharing their opinions when the divorce proceedings are underway.

Sean 'Diddy' Combs threatened to kill rapper Kid Cudi, ex-employee tells US courtFormer employee Capricorn Clark testified that Sean 'Diddy' Combs threatened to kill rapper Kid Cudi after learning of his relationship with Cassie Ventura. Her testimony adds to serious allegations of abuse and threats in Combs' ongoing federal trial.

Diljit Dosanjh finds London's most expensive coffee 'pheeki' in funny vlog. WatchSinger-actor Diljit Dosanjh shared his experience of sipping London's 'most expensive coffee', and it seems that he was not impressed at all.

Actor Shoaib Ibrahim confident of Dipika's cancer recovery, reveals son's reactionTelevision actor Dipika Kakar revealed she's battling second-stage liver cancer but remains hopeful, with surgery planned once she recovers from the flu. Her husband, Shoaib Ibrahim, shared a YouTube video requesting people to pray for her.

Old money, new blood: Ishaan Khatter, Bhumi's The Royals renewed for Season 2Ishaan Khatter and Bhumi Pednekar's 'The Royals' have been renewed for a second season. The makers announced the same with a post on social media.

No physical attack: Actor Unni Mukundan denies assault claim by alleged ex-managerMalayalam actor Unni Mukundan shared a detailed statement on his social media, calling allegations of assault against him 'false'. He also clarified that the man claiming he had assaulted him was never appointed as his manager.

Jr NTR, Kalyan Ram pay tribute to NTR on birth anniversary amid massive crowdActors Jr NTR and Kalyan Ram visited NTR Ghat to pay tribute to their grandfather NTR (Nandamuri Taraka Rama Rao) on his birth anniversary. Their fans gathered at the venue to catch a glimpse of them.

Anushka Sharma blows flying kisses to Virat Kohli after RCB's win over LSG. WatchAnushka Sharma and Virat Kohli blew flying kisses to each other during the Royal Challengers Bengaluru vs Lucknow Super Giants match at IPL 2025 on Tuesday. Their cute video is now going viral on social media.

Amid Vanga-Deepika row, Triptii Dimri bags biggest pay cheque of her careerActor Triptii Dimri has secured her biggest fee of Rs 6 crore for the upcoming film 'Spirit'. The project, directed by Sandeep Reddy Vanga, features 'Baahubali' star Prabhas in the lead role.

general news.headline: Satellite pics show India hit underground site complex at Pak's Murid air baseSatellite images show a 3-metre-wide crater just 30 metres from the entrance of a highly secured sub-complex, possibly housing an underground facility at Murid air base.

Anna University sex assault accused guilty on all charges: Chennai courtA lower court in Chennai found the accused, Gnanasekaran, guilty of sexually assaulting a female student and assaulting her male friend at Anna University. He seeks leniency due to his mother's poor health. Sentencing is on June 2.

Punjab boy who served milk, lassi to jawans during Op Sindoor honoured by ArmyThe Indian Army honoured a 10-year-old boy from Punjab's Ferozepur district for his unwavering committment during the India-Pakistan conflict. education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
